page.title: 19Conservation in Haltwhistle
page.content: A line of crags known as the Nine Nicks of Thirlwall form a dramatic skyline to the north of Haltwhistle. Hadrian built his Wall along the top of this outcrop of the Great Whin Sill. It escaped the fate of other sections of the Wall which were used by General Wade to build his Military Road. Quarrying the whinstone for road chippings removed two of the Nicks and part of the Wall, leaving ugly scars. In 1974 Cawfields Quarry was tidied up, the deepest section flooded and an attractive picnic site created. At Walltown Quarry bulldozers are busy, and plans to create a theme park with reconstructions of a mile castle and part of the Wall, are being examined. Another picnic site is being created where the Burn enters Haltwhistle and many young trees have been planted.
